context_bundle.summary: Notification systems deliver messages via email (SMTP, SendGrid), SMS (Twilio, SNS), and push notifications (FCM, APNs) with templating, scheduling, delivery tracking, and retry logic for reliable user communications.

onboarding.quick_start: Notification workflow: 1) Define notification templates (email, SMS, push). 2) Queue notifications asynchronously. 3) Send via provider APIs with retry logic. 4) Track delivery status (sent, delivered, failed). 5) Handle opt-outs and preferences. 6) Log all notifications for audit. Use batching for bulk notifications and rate limiting to avoid provider throttling.

SMS (Twilio): from twilio.rest import Client; client = Client(account_sid, auth_token); message = client.messages.create(body='Your code is 123456', from_='+1234567890', to='+0987654321'); print(message.sid)

Push (Firebase): import firebase_admin; from firebase_admin import messaging; message = messaging.Message(notification=messaging.Notification(title='Title', body='Body'), token=device_token); response = messaging.send(message)
Template rendering: from jinja2 import Template; template = Template('Hello {{ name }}, your order #{{ order_id }} is ready.'); body = template.render(name='John', order_id='12345')

Async queuing: from celery import Celery; app = Celery('tasks'); @app.task(bind=True, max_retries=3); def send_email(self, to, subject, body): try: email_service.send(to, subject, body) except Exception as e: self.retry(exc=e, countdown=60)
